sentence.idiomatic: Close to 80 percent of netizens support his way of doing things.
The stock market has been awful lately. My shares have lost a lot of their value.
How confident are you that these negotiations will be successful?
There has been more and more unreliable news lately.
I don't really believe him. The stuff he says has never been that reliable.
He didn't dare participate in the contest because he was afraid of losing -- is that fair to say?

word.literal: to inflate something to make it seem better

sentence.idiomatic: This forum is out-of-control. There are just too many people artificially inflating stuff.

word.literal: to inflate something to make it seem more valuable

sentence.idiomatic: These posts are totally worthless. Just look and you can see that they are just hype.

word.literal: to inflate things to make oneself sound better

sentence.idiomatic: We are talking about serious things. Thank you for not hyping stuff.
All his property was stolen by his lover. He had it coming.
After you've finished looking, please help me roll up the picture and put it in the drawer.
During the rising tide last month, quite a few swimmers were swept away by the waves.
Mr. Wang is responsible for managing the funds left over from our last activity.
The original manager resigned. So the company has temporarily made Ms. Li responsible for managing our department.
My friend is out traveling, so I'll help him manage the forum.
You're selling pirated CDs here. Be careful, someone could report you.
Someone reported him to the company for taking outside work.
The Department of Investigation got a report on him. He often accepts bribes from suppliers.
Now you can sign up online. It really saves you a lot of trouble.
Since we've started offering house calls, it's saved a customers a lot of trouble, and business is getting better all the time.
Preparing meals is a lot of trouble. It's easier just to eat at restaurants.
You should spend your money on serious stuff. Don't waste it.
He's always coming and going. Just look at him and you know he's not the kind of person who does things seriously.
I'm talking about marriage with you. Try to be more serious!
You're on Taobao again?
Yeah, I want to buy an iPhone.
You're even going to buy something that expensive online? I'd say buying in a store is safer.

Taobao is quite safe. A lot of the sellers have actual stores, but the online prices are ten to twenty percent cheaper. Look at this 8-gig one. It's just a bit over 5000, but in stores it sells for around 6000.
I still think it's not reliable. Look, some people sell it for 3000 plus, while others sell it for as much as 6000. It's a mess, and there are no guarantees at all.

word.literal: shows action was in the past

sentence.idiomatic: If you're careful when you choose your seller you're fine. Some sellers have thousands of sales, with 100% good ratings. Definitely trustworthy. Some even invite you to the store to browse. How could that be fake?

word.literal: to dupe others by inflating your goods

sentence.idiomatic: It's hard to say. These days there are plenty of people artificially inflating these things. Especially on these high-priced items, if a seller can swindle 15 or 20 people, he can make off with a lot of money.

But if I don't get the merchandise or if I feel there's a problem with the quality, the seller can't get my money. I pay the money to AliPay first, and they hold it. If there's a problem, they can refund my money, and I can also report the seller to the authorities.
Will they return your money just like that? If you really want a refund, I bet there's a big long process. Just thinking about it stresses me out. Going to a store saves you the trouble.

You're just afraid of being duped. I'm telling you, I have a lot of co-workers that have all bought expensive things on Taobao with no problems. Besides, online shopping has already matured. The vast majority of people are doing legitimate business. They're not con artists.
Anyway, just be careful and you should be fine. But if you do buy it, let me know. If it's good, I'll do it too.
You're too much, using me as a test subject!

word.literal: to dupe others by inflating your goods
